H0.text: Decrease is the height of the water when a rock is placed in a graduated cylinder containing water.

H1.text: Increase is the height of the water when a rock is placed in a graduated cylinder containing water.

H2.text: The height of the water will remain the same when a rock is placed in a graduated cylinder containing water.

A3.text: Suppose that, when the rock is lowered into the water, it displaces water of weight 3 newtons.

A4.text: Archimedes' principle states that the buoyant force on an object is equal to the weight of the fluid displaced by the object.
